entry.title: Titiou Lecoq (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Titiou Lecoq (pictured) only realized that "women did not rule the universe" after she left home?

entry.title: Brandiose (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Brandiose's design work for the Rocket City Trash Pandas helped the team sell $4 million in merchandise before it played its first game?

entry.title: Tupou VI (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tupou VI was crowned by D'Arcy Wood, an Australian, in order to respect the tradition of native Tongans not touching the king's head?

entry.title: Aleister Crowley's 1941 manifesto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Aleister Crowley's 1941 manifesto controversially asserts a human right to commit tyrannicide?

entry.title: Begüm Pusat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Begüm Pusat, a 15-year-old Turkish wheelchair basketballer, was one of the youngest players at the 2019 Women's U25 World Championship?

entry.title: her constituency of South West Norfolk in 2024 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that by losing her constituency of South West Norfolk in 2024, Liz Truss became the first former UK prime minister since 1935 to lose their seat?

entry.title: Carey Wright (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Carey Wright implemented literacy reforms that led to the "Mississippi Miracle"?

entry.title: Upper Ivory Coast (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Upper Ivory Coast was created from the former French Upper Volta to facilitate the provision of forced plantation labour?

entry.title: Quintus Quincy Quigley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Quintus Quincy Quigley preferred Angles to a ring?
